sentences: Rolando Villazón Mauleón (born 22 February 1972) is a Mexican operatic tenor and opera director.
He now lives in France, and in 2007 became a French citizen.
He came to international attention in 1999 when he won second prize in Plácido Domingo's Operalia competition (losing to Bulgarian bass Orlin Anastassov), as well as the first Zarzuela prize.
In 2000 he appeared for the first time at the Berlin State Opera, as Macduff in Macbeth.
In Munich in 2000 he sang Rodolfo in La bohème and in 2002 in Los Angeles, Rinuccio in Gianni Schicchi.
In Munich in 2000 he sang Rodolfo in La bohème and in 2002 in Los Angeles, Rinuccio in Gianni Schicchi.
In 2003 he sang Rodolfo at the Glyndebourne Festival Opera in England.
The following year he appeared as Alfredo in La traviata at the Metropolitan Opera, New York, and in 2005, both at St. Petersburg and the Salzburg Festival.
In August 2005, he sang a highly regarded Alfredo in Verdi's La traviata at the Salzburg Festival, conducted by Carlo Rizzi, directed by Willy Decker.
In 2007, Villazón switched his recording company and signed an exclusive long-term contract with Deutsche Grammophon.
An album of zarzuelas (Gitano, Virgin Classics) conducted by Plácido Domingo, was released in Spring 2007.
The U.S. version of his album Viva Villazón (Virgin Classics) was released in September 2007.
In early 2010 he was a mentor and judge in the ITV show Popstar to Operastar.
In 2007, Villazón cancelled many of his scheduled engagements in order to diagnose and remedy a persistent vocal issue.
section: == Career == | === Vocal surgery and the return to the stage ===

sentences: In May 2009, Rolando Villazón announced that he had to undergo surgery in order to remove a congenital cyst in one of his vocal cords.
section: == Career == | === Vocal surgery and the return to the stage ===

sentences: After completing his rehabilitation, he returned to the stage in March 2010 singing Nemorino in L'elisir d'amore at the Vienna State Opera in March 2010, and then embarked on a series of recitals.
section: == Career == | === Vocal surgery and the return to the stage ===

sentences: He made his debut as a stage director with a new production of Werther at the Opéra de Lyon in January 2011.
section: == Career == | === Vocal surgery and the return to the stage ===

sentences: In December 2012, he appeared as Rodolfo in La bohème at London's Royal Opera House, a role he first sang there in 2005.
section: == Career == | === Vocal surgery and the return to the stage ===

sentences: His first all-Mozart solo album featuring the composer's concert arias for tenor was released in January 2014.

sentences: Villazón sang "La Prima Luce" on the 2014 Yanni/Plácido Domingo/Ric Wake collaboration album Inspirato.

He now lives in France, and in 2007 became a French citizen.
He said that one day, as he was getting out of the shower in his apartment in Mexico City, somebody came knocking on his door
Late 1990s and early 2000s
The same year he sang for the first time in Italy as des Grieux in Manon at the Teatro Carlo Felice in Genoa.
Over the years he has presented many of his best roles there, among them José in Carmen and des Grieux in Manon.
The following year he appeared as Alfredo in La traviata at the Metropolitan Opera, New York, and in 2005, both at St. Petersburg and the Salzburg Festival.

In recent years, Villazon has undertaken a number of Mozart tenor roles both in concert and in operatic performances, notably Don Ottavio in Mozart's Don Giovanni at the Festspiel Baden-Baden, the role of Alessandro in Mozart's Il re pastore under William Christie at Zürich Opera House.
